metadata.title: CVE-2022-22721 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
If LimitXMLRequestBody is set to allow request bodies larger than 350MB(defaults to 1M) on 32 bit systems an integer overflow happens which latercauses out of bounds writes. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52and earlier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.10
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.10
apache2-data - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.10
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.10
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.10
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.10
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.10
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-4ubuntu3.10').
